info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 12 at 5:04PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT NORTH CENTRAL RABUN AND SOUTHEASTERN MACON COUNTIES THROUGH 545 PM EDT... At 504 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 9 miles southwest of Franklin, moving east at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Franklin, Dillard, Sky Valley, Mountain City, Scaly Mountain, Otto, Rainbow Springs, Cullasaja, and Wayah Bald. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
